result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronshea Vashon Franklin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronshea Vashon Franklin appeared by video.  Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Ronshea Vashon Franklin.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of the defendants 3 prior OWI's. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Sheriff Deputy A. Bishtawi. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-27-22

Defendant Ronshea Vashon Franklin in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Ronshea Vashon Franklin.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Case needs a preliminary hearing. Case is adjourned.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed: Attorney Jade Hall

Defendant Ronshea Vashon Franklin in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel. SPD has not yet appointed counsel. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Defendant Ronshea Vashon Franklin in court.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for indegency hearing. Statements by defendant that he wishes to retain attorney Wales. Court order case adjourned for status of counsel, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Defendant Ronshea Vashon Franklin in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for status. Defendant appears without counsel. Defendant is not eligible for SPD and has not retained private counsel. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Defendant Ronshea Vashon Franklin in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for status of counsel. Defendant is not eligible for SPD and has not retained counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronshea Vashon Franklin in court by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for status of counsel. Defendant plans to retain Attorney Michael Hayes.   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-27-22.

Defendant Ronshea Vashon Franklin in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Mr Franklin is not eligible for SPD appointment and has not retained counsel. Mr Franklin states that he does plan to hire an Attorney, but that he needs a little more time to do so. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Ronshea Vashon Franklin in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Ronshea Vashon Franklin in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ronshea Vashon Franklin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
